skill.name: deslop
skill.description: Remove AI-generated code slop from a branch. Use when cleaning up AI-generated code, removing unnecessary comments, defensive checks, or type casts. Checks diff against main and fixes style inconsistencies.
skill.summary: Remove AI-generated code slop from a branch. Use when cleaning up AI-generated code, removing unnece...
skill.author: getsentry

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. All 37 static findings are false positives from scanning metadata files. The skill provides behavioral guidelines for cleaning AI-generated code patterns through natural language instructions only.

content.value_statement: AI-generated code often includes excessive comments, defensive checks, and unnecessary patterns. This skill reviews git diffs against main and systematically removes code slop while preserving legitimate changes.
actual_capabilities: Review git diff against main branch for AI-generated patterns
Identify and remove excessive comments inconsistent with codebase style
Eliminate unnecessary defensive checks and try-catch blocks in trusted code paths
Fix inline imports and type casts to any in Python and TypeScript
Report concise summary of cleanup actions performed
Preserve legitimate functional changes while removing stylistic bloat
limitations: Only operates on changed files in the current branch diff
Requires manual review to prevent removal of legitimate code patterns
Does not fix logic bugs or improve algorithmic efficiency
Cannot detect slop patterns in files unchanged from main branch

use_cases.title: Clean Feature Branches Before PR
use_cases.description: Remove AI-generated patterns before submitting pull requests for cleaner code review and faster approval

use_cases.title: Enforce Team Code Standards
use_cases.description: Systematically identify and flag AI slop patterns in submitted code changes during review process

use_cases.title: Maintain Codebase Quality Standards
use_cases.description: Ensure AI-assisted contributions meet team style guidelines before merging to main branch

prompt_templates.title: Basic Branch Cleanup
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the deslop skill to clean up this branch. Review the diff against main and remove all AI-generated slop.

prompt_templates.title: Remove Comments Only
prompt_templates.prompt: Use deslop to remove only the extra comments from this branch. Keep defensive checks and try-catch blocks.

prompt_templates.title: Full Slop Removal
prompt_templates.prompt: Run deslop with full scope. Remove comments, defensive checks, type casts to any, and inline imports from my branch.

prompt_templates.title: Report Only Mode
prompt_templates.prompt: Use deslop to identify all slop patterns in this branch. Report what should be removed without making any changes.

output_examples.input: Use deslop to clean up my current feature branch against main
output: Removed 12 excessive comments from src/utils.ts and src/api.ts
Eliminated 3 unnecessary defensive null checks in validated code paths
Fixed 2 inline Python imports to top-of-file format
Summary: Cleaned up AI patterns while preserving 5 legitimate feature changes

output_examples.input: Run deslop in report-only mode on my authentication refactor
output: Found 8 excessive comments in auth/login.py explaining obvious operations
Identified 4 unnecessary try-catch blocks wrapping validated input handlers
Detected 2 type casts to any bypassing TypeScript type safety
Recommendation: Remove these patterns to align with codebase standards

best_practices: Review slop removal suggestions before accepting changes to ensure legitimate code is preserved
Run deslop after AI code generation but before committing to keep diffs clean and reviewable
Use deslop during code review phase to maintain consistent codebase style across team contributions
anti_patterns: Applying deslop to branches with unrelated changes from multiple contributors without coordination
Running deslop without reviewing what will be removed first and blindly accepting all suggestions
Expecting deslop to fix logic bugs, improve algorithmic efficiency, or handle security vulnerabilities

faq.question: Does deslop work with all git workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. Deslop works with any git-based workflow. It uses git diff main...HEAD by default to compare changes.

faq.question: What specific patterns does deslop remove?
faq.answer: Excessive comments, unnecessary defensive checks, type casts to any, inline imports, and other AI-generated style inconsistencies.

faq.question: Can deslop integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Deslop is an AI skill for interactive use, not a standalone CI tool. Use it during development or code review phases.

faq.question: Is my code safe when using deslop?
faq.answer: Deslop only provides guidelines to the AI platform. All code changes require your explicit approval before being applied.

faq.question: Why are my legitimate changes being flagged for removal?
faq.answer: Deslop may misinterpret some patterns as slop. Always review suggestions carefully and restore any legitimate code manually.

faq.question: How does deslop differ from traditional linters?
faq.answer: Linters enforce syntax and style rules. Deslop targets AI-specific code patterns and context that linters cannot detect.
